title: Arches National Park: Plan Your Visit
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit           Plan Your Visit        Hikers on the Windows Trail near Turret Arch    Â   The red rock landscape at Arches might feel timeless, dream-like, or even other-worldly... but traffic congestion during peak season (March to October) can quickly bring one back to reality. Planning ahead can help make your visit as enjoyable as possible. Basic InformationLearn important trip-planning facts, such as Operating Hours, Fees, Current Conditions, Pets, Weather and more.CampingLearn about camping at Arches and in the area surrounding the park.NOTE: Devils Garden Campground will be closed March 1 through October 31, 2017, due to a major construction project.Directions How to get to Arches from nearby cities in Utah and Colorado. Places to GoThese are the major sites to see in Arches National Park.Traffic & Travel TipsAdvice on avoiding the crowds. Things To DoExplore the many activities possible in the park, such as hiking, camping, and ranger-led programs. Trip ItinerariesBrowse suggestions on how to spend your visit. SafetyLearn how to stay safe in the desert. Park Regulations How to protect your park. The park Calendar, Nearby Attractions, and Accessibility pages might help you make the most of your visit. You can also connect to the park and get help planning your trip via our social media sites, including Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and more.
